subject: Travel
title: Zheng He's Treasure Fleet
description: A micro-lesson that makes Zheng He's Treasure Fleet usable.

hook.text: In 1405, China launched the largest fleet the world had ever seen. The flagship was 400 feet long.

buildup.text: Admiral Zheng He commanded 300 ships and 28,000 men on seven voyages across the Indian Ocean.

discovery.text: The fleet reached East Africa, Arabia, and Southeast Asia, trading porcelain, silk, and gifts.

twist.text: A new emperor decided sea voyages were wasteful. He burned the fleet and banned ocean travel.

climax.text: China turned inward. Decades later, tiny Portuguese ships reached the same waters unopposed.

punchline.text: China ruled the seas, then chose to stop.

quiz.question: Why did China's treasure voyages end?
options: A new emperor banned ocean travel
